alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Pike; Southern Wayne; Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 14 at 3:30PM EDT until March 14 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Storm total snowfall amounts from 1 to 4 inches in the valleys and 5 to 9 inches in the higher elevations. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Susquehanna, Lackawanna, Pike and Southern Wayne counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorist to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways, and traffic conditions.
